block.p: Gillian Zoe Segal, the daughter of Leanor Segal and the stepdaughter of Alvin Segal of Montreal, was married there last evening to Peter Todd Lattman, a son of Ellen and Stanley Lattman of Roslyn Harbor, N.Y. Rabbi Barbara Borts officiated at the Chalet in Mont-Royal Park.

The bride, 31, is a freelance photographer specializing in portraits. She graduated from the University of Michigan and received a law degree from Yeshiva University. Her mother is the chairwoman of the 2001 campaign of the Combined Jewish Appeal in Montreal. The bride's stepfather is the chief executive of Peerless Clothing, a men's wear manufacturer in Montreal.

The bride's stepfather is the chief executive of Peerless Clothing, a men's wear manufacturer in Montreal.

The bridegroom, 29, is an associate in the investment management division of Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. He graduated cum laude from Harvard University and received a law degree from Fordham. His father is an owner of Norstan Apparel Shops Inc., a New York company that runs a chain of women's clothing stores called Fashion Cents.
